metadata.Title: CVE-2019-12958 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In Xpdf 4.01.01, a heap-based buffer over-read could be triggered in FoFiType1C::convertToType0 in fofi/FoFiType1C.cc when it is trying to access the second privateDicts array element, because the privateDicts array has only one element allocated.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-12958` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.6
libpoppler-cpp0 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.6
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.6
libpoppler-qt4-4 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.6
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.6
libpoppler58 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.6
poppler-utils - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.6
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> xpdf in koffice is 2.0 mdeslaur> looks like CVE-2017-14976 in poppler ebarretto> since 0.5.12-1 libextractor does not use xpdf anymore. xpdf in Debian uses poppler, which is not affected or fixed

criterions.comment: poppler package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.41.0-0ubuntu1.6').
xpdf: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
